intro: Amyema seriata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes and is characterized by its pod fruits. The plant features slender, zigzagging stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a narrow, linear shape, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Amyema seriata is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
